result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

03:14 15TR1000 and 15TR1362 also heard at this time. Defendant Christopher David Welker in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. O'Sullivan: dismiss 15TR1000, dismiss count 1 and 2 in 15CM140, DPA in count 3 and 4 in 15CM140, and plead no contest in 15TR1362 $937.50, 6 month revocation.  Nelson and defendant agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.   DEF PLEADS GUILTY to count 3 and 4 of the complaint.    Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of counts 3 and 4 in 15CM140.  Court orders: judgment of conviction not to be entered at this time on counts 3 and 4 in 15CM140 pending outcome of DPA, counts 1 and 2 in 15CM140 dismissed, 15TR1000 also dismissed.  Court approves DPA and signs the agreement.  Clerk's office will give defendant copies. 
Court addresses 15TR1362:  Defendant pleads guilty, court finds defendant guilty and orders:  $937.50, 1 year to pay, 6 month revocation of DL, credit for administrative suspension and complete AODA. 03:27
Plea hearing at 03-14-2016 02:30 pm.
Includes 15TR1000 and 15TR1362.  11:07 a.m.  Nelson - client is ill and requests plea be rescheduled.  O'Sullivan agrees.  See JA for new date.

4:21 Defendant Christopher David Welker in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appears in court.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and maximum penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Nelson enters in not guilty pleas on behalf of Def. Court rec's and enters. OSullivan; $1000 signature bond. Nelson has no objection. Def has not been in the armed services.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 11:45 am.
